title: [K-12] Learning from Failure in the Design Process: Strengthening Mathematical Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Knowledge and Understanding of Fundamental Design Thinking Concepts
context.additional_context: Providing experiences that reframe failure in mathematical problem-solving as learning opportunities, emphasizing real-time feedback via online collaboration tools

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze failure cases in math problems and derive improvement strategies by applying the design thinking process.
Learners can experience a psychological shift, perceiving failure not as an object of fear but as a learning tool.
Learners can share failures in the math problem-solving process and propose collaborative solutions through peer evaluation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
